post.title: Welcome to BlogEngine.NET
post.description: The description is used as the meta description as well as shown in the related posts. It is recommended that you write a description, but not mandatory
post.content:
If you see this post it means that BlogEngine.NET is running and the hard part of creating your own blog is done. There is only one thing you need to do from this point on to take full advantage of the blog and that is to set up the first author profile.

Write Permissions

To be able to log in to the blog and writing posts, you need to enable write permissions on the App_Data folder. If you’re blog is hosted at a hosting provider, you can either log into your account’s admin page or call the support. You need write permissions on the App_Data folder because all posts and comments are saved as XML files and placed in the App_Data folder.

Setup

Find and open the users.xml file which is located in the App_Data folder. Edit the default user (Admin) and provide your own name as the username and a password of your choice. You can safely remove the Editor user if you have no need for it. Save the users.xml file.

[code:xml]

<Users>
  <User>
     <UserName>Yourname</UserName>
     <Password>yourpass</Password>
     <Email>you@example.com</Email>
     <LastLoginTime>2007-04-09 13:00:23</LastLoginTime>
  </User>
</Users>

[/code]

Next, open the roles.xml file which is also in the App_Data folder. Replace the Admin username with your own username used above and remove the Editor username if you don't plan to use it. Save the file and you should be able to log in using your new username and start writing posts.

[code:xml]

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" standalone="yes"?>
<roles>
  <role>
    <name>Administrators</name>
    <users>
      <user>Yourname</user>
    </users>
  </role>
  <role>
    <name>Editors</name>
    <users>
      <user>Yourname</user>
    </users>
  </role>
</roles>

[/code]

On the web

You can find BlogEngine.NET on the official website. Here you'll find tutorials, documentation, tips and tricks and much more. The ongoing development of BlogEngine.NET can be followed at CodePlex where the daily builds will be published for anyone to download.

Good luck and happy writing.

The BlogEngine.NET team
